isis.stitle: AIR COMPRESSOR: MIDLAND MODELS EL-1300 AND EL-1600 - ASSEMBLE

svcsubsecinfo.para: Apply a coat of engine oil to crankshaft, bearings, connecting rod bearings, piston pins, pistons and cylinder block bore.

step1.para: Press a new oil seal into the front bearing cap. Use a sealer on the outside seal rim. Spring side should be facing inward.
Place crankshaft into crankcase then place rear bearing onto crankshaft.

Position the crankcase/crankshaft assembly in the arbor press supporting the assembly on the inner race of the rear bearing. Press the crankshaft into the bearing applying force to the crankshaft until the inner race of the rear bearing is seated firmly against the shoulder of the crankshaft. The rear bearing will also be forced into the case. Press crankshaft assembly into crankcase. Be sure that both front and rear bearings protrude an equal amount from each end of the crankcase. Rotate crankshaft to be sure it turns freely.

caution.para: When pressing the crankshaft into rear bearing and into crankcase, be sure that the crankshaft and bearing are straight and not cocked, or damage may occur to the case and/or bearing.
